The worsened symptoms at night and sleep disturbance are consistent with unilateral or lateralized airway narrowing caused by septal deviation.  2. They tend to lead to chronic blockage worse at night and can produce crusting due to chronic inflammation. The description of crusting and dryness aligns with polyp-associated mucosal changes, and the whistling sound suggests airway narrowing potentially caused by polyps.  3. While crusting is less typical, dryness and congestion are common. No systemic allergy symptoms are mentioned, but chronic inflammation can cause nasal dryness and blockages worsened at night.  4. Diagnosis: Chronic Rhinosinusitis Justification: Persistent congestion with crusting suggests ongoing mucosal inflammation consistent with sinus disease. Sleep disturbance and nasal obstruction are common features; crusting reflects impaired mucociliary clearance. The absence of reported facial pain reduces likelihood but does not exclude this.  5.
